titles.title: Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act
Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act
Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act
Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act
Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act
Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act
To provide for the conveyance of the Forest Service Lake Hill Administrative Site in Summit County, Colorado.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation.
Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 113-196.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 143.

action.text: Mr. Young (AK) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2337.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Landrieu without amendment. With written report No. 113-173.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 399.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
7/25/2014--Public Law. Lake Hill Administrative Site Affordable Housing Act - Directs the Secretary of Agriculture (USDA) to convey to Summit County, Colorado, all interest of the United States in the approximately 40 acres of National Forest System land in the county identified as the Lake Hill Administrative Site.
Makes Summit County responsible for the processing and transaction costs related to the direct sale of the land.
Requires the proceeds received from such conveyance to be made available for capital improvement and maintenance of Forest Service facilities in Region 2 of the Forest Service.
